oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Knoxville's Million Dollar Fire, April 8, 1897
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Published by J.E. Auldridge, Knoxville, Tenn.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Knoxville's Million Dollar Fire, April 8, 1897. Booklet published by J.E. Auldridge, Knoxville, Tenn. Features photographs of Knoxville, Tennessee's "Million Dollar Fire" of April 8, 1897. Includes map showing the fire burned district. Advertisers at the back of the booklet include: McArthur & Sons; Knoxville Centennial Building, Baumann Brothers, Architects; Hotel Imperial; Mester, Newcomer & Company; Marble City Drug Mfg. Co.; Sterchi Bros.; Sanford, Chamberlain & Albers Co.; J. Rawls Anderson and Col. W.A. Gage, Civil Engineers; The Dixie Stamp Factory; Knoxville Bicycle Hospital; Hotel Flanders; J.E. Auldridge; and Chapman, White, Lyons Co.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Fires;
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Cataloged book collection, McClung Historical Collection
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: For information on license and use fees and acquiring high-resolution image files, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8814.
